response:
reasoning='1. Horizontal range requirement:  For a V-shaped dive to 400 m, each leg has horizontal run 400 / tanθ, so total horizontal distance D = 800 / tanθ.  Setting D ≥ 4000 m gives tanθ ≤ 0.2 ⇒ θ ≤ 11.3°.  Pick θ = 10° (comfortable margin).

2. Travel time:  Each leg length L = 400 / sin10° = 2303 m, total path length 4606 m.  With speed 1 m s⁻¹, time t = 4606 s = 1.28 h < 2 h (meets time limit).

3. Energy check:  Power model P(z)=P₀+ l·m + k·z with P₀=100 W, l=0.05 W kg⁻¹, k=0.2 W m⁻¹.
   • Choose total mass m = 300 kg (≥200 kg).
   • Mean operating depth for a symmetric dive is z̄ = 200 m.
   • Average power P̄ = 100 + 0.05·300 + 0.2·200 = 155 W.
   • Energy E = P̄·t = 155 W × 1.28 h = 198.4 Wh ≤ 200 Wh (within battery limit).

4. Volume & buoyancy:  Select volume V = 0.40 m³ (allowed range 0.2–1 m³).
   • Average density ρ_glider = m / V = 300 kg / 0.40 m³ = 750 kg m⁻³ ≤ 1025 kg m⁻³, so the craft can float when required.

All performance, energy and physical constraints are satisfied with the chosen parameters.' config=ConfigFile(angle=10.0, volume=0.4, mass=300.0)
